article.title: New giant radio sources and underluminous radio halos in two galaxy clusters

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of object is shown in the left panel of Figure 1, overlaid on an X-ray image?
What observing array was used to produce the radio contours in Figure 2?
What is the likely classification of the elongated radio source shown in Figure 4, based on its morphology and spectral index?
What does the position of A1451 and Z0634 in Figure 9, relative to the black line and shaded region, imply about their radio halos?
choices: They are typical giant radio halos.
They are ultra steep spectrum radio halos.

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical process is described by Formula 3 in the context of head-tail radio galaxies?
choices: Synchrotron and IC losses, determining the break frequency
